modules.description: This module defines a polymorphic variant type for representing colors, including standard named colors and RGB values. It provides functions to convert color values to their corresponding string representations for use in Gnuplot commands. Concrete use cases include specifying plot line colors or surface color schemes in generated Gnuplot scripts.

This module defines a type `t` for representing labeled data points in 2D space, with optional string labels for x and y coordinates. It provides the `create` function to construct labeled points with customizable x and y labels. This module is useful for generating annotated plots where each point requires textual identification along either axis.

This module defines fill styles for plots, supporting solid fills and predefined pattern fills. It works with the `t` variant type to specify fill options directly in plotting functions. Use it to customize the visual appearance of filled areas in graphs, such as histograms or shaded regions.

This module defines an output type for configuring gnuplot rendering targets such as PNG, EPS, or interactive displays. It supports creating output configurations with options like font, image size, and backend-specific parameters. Use it to specify how and where gnuplot should render plots, for example saving to a PNG file or displaying in a GUI window.

This module defines data ranges for plotting, supporting operations to specify axis limits and time-based intervals. It works with floating-point numbers, date, time, and timezone types to set precise bounds for X, Y, or combined XY axes, as well as date and time ranges. Use this module to constrain plots to specific numerical or temporal regions, such as limiting a graph to a particular date range or zooming into a subset of data points.

This module supports creation of visualizations including line, point, step, and combined plots from numerical data sequences, with specialized variants for time-series and date-based Y-axis values. It handles histograms via value distributions and candlestick charts using OHLC (open-high-low-close) data with temporal indexing, supporting both timezone-aware timestamps and calendar dates. These operations cater to financial analysis, statistical reporting, and time-dependent data visualization where customizable aesthetics like color and line weight enhance interpretability.

This module orchestrates the creation and customization of visualizations by managing gnuplot sessions and coordinating with submodules to define plot appearance, data structure, and output targets. It supports key data types such as ranges for axis constraints, fill styles for shaded regions, labeled points for annotations, and output configurations for rendering destinations. Operations include setting titles and grid options, defining series with time-series or numerical data, applying colors to lines or surfaces, and exporting plots in formats like PNG or EPS. Specific tasks include generating histograms with pattern fills, plotting financial candlestick charts with OHLC data, and rendering time-based scatter plots with custom fonts and dimensions.
